snippet: The original e-mails, released in 2009, sowed doubts about scientists’ research and integrity, and galvanized skeptics of global warming.
abstract: Speculation resumes about origin of e-mails released in 2009 on the eve of United Nations climate conference in Copenhagen that sowed doubts about scientists' integrity and research into global warming; more e-mails leaked from the University of East Anglia in England, and signs that a British policy inquiry is underway, have inspired musings on both sides of climate change debate.
lead_paragraph: The original e-mails, released in 2009, sowed doubts about scientists’ research and integrity, and galvanized skeptics of global warming.

headline.seo: New Speculation on Who Leaked Climate-Change E-Mails
headline.main: Police Inquiry Prompts New Speculation on Who Leaked Climate-Change E-Mails
headline.print_headline: Police Inquiry Prompts New Speculation on Who Leaked Climate-Change E-Mails
